Is there any validation for this? Is 0 allowed? Are negative numbers allowed? Is there an upper bound? What if I specify 100000000 ?

Negative numbers are not allowed, validation is part of another PR (the current one is about API change):
https://github.com/gliush/kubernetes/pull/2/files#diff-4364e3f754b12e39f60eea33105f6c7eR203
it is int32, any positive number is correct. It does not have a lot of sense, though, I do not see a reason why we should forbid that.

We are going to add validation to limit the periodSeconds with some reasonable amount of time (60min?). It is being done.

@thockin we want to have a a flag in the controller so that cluster operators can specify the maximum allowed value(because this affects how many events are stored in the controller, by default we want to restrict it to 30 mins). Since we don't have access to the controller values in the validation at this stage we can only validate that it is a positive value. If a value which is too large is specified an HPA will be created but it will stay disable/inactive.
I've added validation that will restrict periodSeconds to 30min
